categories: Category:Star Wars: The Clone Wars voice actors
Category:Star Wars: The Old Republic voice actors

nodes.text: Nolan Ramsey North (born October 31, 1970 in New Haven, Connecticut) is an American actor and voice actor who voiced El-Les in the Star Wars: The Clone Wars, a dozen characters, including the male Jedi Consular, in Star Wars: The Old Republic and its expansions, and a few characters in Kinect Star Wars.

He is credited in more than 400 works, mostly for video games and animation. Some of his most known roles include Raphael in the 2007 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles movie (which he co-starred with fellow Star Wars: The Clone Wars voice actor, James Arnold Taylor), Desmond Miles in the video game series Assassin's Creed, Sergent Forge in both Halo Wars, ODST Romeo in Halo 3: ODST, Ghost in the video game series Destiny, the Penguin in the video game series Batman: Arkham, and Doctor Edward Richtofen in the zombies mode of the video game series Call of Duty. He also voiced Tony Stark/Iron Man in the 2020 Marvel's Avengers game. However, it's for the video game series Uncharted that he is most recognized, having given both his voice and motion capture to help bring Nathan Drake to "life", and was nominated several time for Best Performance for this role, for eventually winning the TGA Award for Best Performance in 2016.
